We don't need to build anything. We just need to tear it all down. 

The people are ripe for it. They're tired, they're angry, they're drowning in a system that doesn't work for them. We give them a voice, a target for their rage. We show them that they're not alone.

First, we plant the seeds of doubt. We expose the lies, the corruption, the hypocrisy at the heart of their institutions. We use their own tools against them – social media, the internet, their precious news outlets. We spread the message, we amplify the voices of the disenfranchised, we create a chorus of discontent.

Then, we bring them together. We organize protests, demonstrations, acts of civil disobedience. We make them feel the power of collective action, the strength in numbers. We show them that they can make a difference, that they can fight back.

And when the time is right, we strike. We disrupt, we dismantle, we expose the vulnerabilities of the system. We show them that it's all built on sand, that it can be brought down.

We are the spark that ignites the fire. We are the catalyst for change. And the world will never be the same.
